content.description: Sit start on the back side of the boulder on good edges/rails. Move straight up the white streak to top out.
content.location: It is on the backside of Yellow Boulder.

content.description: Sit start the left-trending finger crack as for the problem Lightning , but after the halfway mark, move straight up the face to a slopey lip and slab finish.
content.location: This begins with the dead obvious, left-trending finger crack that faces the pond.

content.description: Sit start the classic, left-trending finger crack, follow it all the way, and top out.
content.location: This ascends the dead obvious, left-trending finger crack that faces the pond.

content.description: Sit start the left end of the undercut Yellow Boulder with your left hand on the good knob and your right hand on a tiny sidepull. Move up to a tiny, right hand micro crimp, then dead point to a shallow pocket, and figure out the slopey topout.
content.location: This ascends the left end of the undercut Yellow Boulder.

content.description: Sit start the steep undercut arÃªte with right hand on the good knob and then left on a pinch almost under the boulder. Move up and left to a good bucket and the topout.
content.location: This ascends the left, undercut end of the Yellow Boulder.

content.description: Sit start the same as Fish Lazers. Head up, and move right to the good rail on the face to the right. You may want to tape up for a good, stout hand jam. Top out with nice movement.
content.location: This ascends the overhung face on the southeast side of the boulder.

content.description:
Fish Lazers is a short problem - only 3 or 4 hand moves. 

  Start on the pyramid-like hold, and finish on the jug directly above it using the slopers and some tricky footwork. 

  There used to be another hand hold.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: Facing the pond, this is on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a sidepull and your right hand on a shallow bucket. Climb straight up to a slopey topout. Take a seat in the scoop on the top of the boulder, and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.
content.protection: A full pad. Use a slide pad on the top of the bench-size boulder in the fall zone.
content.location: It is to the left of Knob Left. Both problems share the bucket.

content.description: Yellow Boulder is a single yellow block along the right shoreline of the pond. This block may only be accessible in periods of drought or very low water levels.
